prompt.0:
Please translate the following text from English to German. Do not ask any questions or give any reasons, just provide the translation. Examples: English = "Apple" -> German = "Apfel", English = "Car" -> German = "Auto", English = "Mayor" -> German = "Bürgermeister", English = "Pollution" -> German = "Verschmutzung", English = "Interest" -> German = "Zins", English = "Pandemic" -> German = "Pandemie", English = "Energy" -> German = "Energie", English = "Discovery" -> German = "Entdeckung", English = "Quantum" -> German = "Quanten", English = "Therapy" -> German = "Therapie". Here is the text: "The head of state also has the right to appoint interim ministers during Senate recesses lasting at least ten days. This is to ensure the government's ability to function. The ministers appointed in this manner must be confirmed by the Senate by the end of the session period to remain in office.

The Republicans secured a majority in the Senate with at least 53 of the 100 seats in the election. However, the Democrats could delay the appointment process in the relevant committees."

source_text.0:
The head of state also has the right to appoint interim ministers during Senate recesses lasting at least ten days. This is to ensure the government's ability to function. The ministers appointed in this manner must be confirmed by the Senate by the end of the session period to remain in office.

The Republicans secured a majority in the Senate with at least 53 of the 100 seats in the election. However, the Democrats could delay the appointment process in the relevant committees.

hypothesis.0:
**Translation:**

Der Staatchef hat das Recht, interimmäßige Minister zu ernennen während Sitzabungen von mindestens 10 Tagen zu stellen. Dies ist zur Sicherung der Regierungsbereitung. Die Minister, die im Rahmen dieses Prozesses eingesetzt werden, müssen vom Senat durch die Sitzungsdauer bestätigt werden, um ihre Position zu behalten.

reference_text.0:
Der Staatschef hat zugleich aber das Recht, vorläufig Minister während mindestens zehn Tage langen Sitzungspausen des Senats einzusetzen. Das soll die Handlungsfähigkeit der Regierung gewährleisten. Die so ernannten Minister müssen dann bis Ende der Sitzungsperiode vom Senat bestätigt werden, um weiter im Amt zu bleiben.

Die Republikaner sicherten sich bei der Wahl eine Mehrheit im Senat mit mindestens 53 der 100 Sitze. Die Demokraten könnten aber das Ernennungsverfahren in den zuständigen Ausschüssen verzögern.
